oscilloscup.data.math

Class Function

  • java.lang.Object
    • oscilloscup.data.math.Function

  • public abstract class Function
extends java.lang.Object

    The function class is a facility class usable to generate figure that represent mathematical curves.

      Function()

    • Method Detail

      • evaluate

        public abstract Point evaluate(double d)
        Evaluate the function at the given position. The return element is not a single number but a point. This allow the modelisation of parametric functions.
        Parameters:
        d -
        Returns:
        Point

      • getDefinitionValues

        public double[] getDefinitionValues()
        Sets the set of values on which the function is defined.
        Returns:
        double[]

      • setDefinitionValues

        public void setDefinitionValues(double[] values)
        Sets the set of values on which the function is defined. Note that allow only to modelise descrete functions. This is not a problem because the goal of Up is the representation and the representing a non-discrete function is, anyway, a discrete process.
        Parameters:
        values -

      • setDefinitionValues

        public void setDefinitionValues(double start,
                                double end)
        Sets a definition interval for the function. In this interval, the definition set is made of 100 points in the interval.
        Parameters:
        start -
        end -

      • setDefinitionValues

        public void setDefinitionValues(double start,
                                double end,
                                double step)
        Sets a definition interval for the function with the given step.
        Parameters:
        start -
        end -
        step -

      • createFigure

        public Figure createFigure()
        Creates a figure that is the representation of the function on its interval.
        Returns:
        Figure
